item.title: Acknowledging the accomplishments and goals of the Youth Impact Program.

latestAction.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

item.title: A resolution acknowledging the accomplishments and goals of the Youth Impact Program.

latestAction.text: Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent. (consideration: CR S10837; text as passed Senate: CR S10837; text of measure as introduced: CR S10834-10835)

item.text: Referred to the Committee on the Judiciary. (text of measure as introduced: CR S10754)

summary.text:
Congratulates Mr. Riki Ellison for his leadership and vision in founding the Youth Impact Program (which provides at-risk young men in the inner cities with football training and mentoring designed to improve their academic performance and character).

Recognizes the contributions of the National Football League, the University of Southern California, and Tulane University to the Youth Impact program.

Encourages the expansion of the Youth Impact Program to inner cities across the United States.

bill.title: A resolution acknowledging the accomplishments and goals of the Youth Impact Program.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
